intro: Eremostachys iliensis, commonly known as the Ili Desert eryngo, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Eremostachys iliensis is valued for its resilience and is sometimes cultivated in xerophytic gardens.
